messages.message:
Hey team, I noticed an edge-case flow that could be disorienting to customers.

I am able to see + access a Deployment and see the corresponding runs + data. I would assume that clicking the app name would open the app. Instead I am presented with an error modal and redirected to Home.

I would expect for this error message to appear as an overly over the initial screen. Being redirected and then dumped out on Home isn't ideal.

(screenshots attached, in order)
hmm, that is a strange situation. Both versions for this app are set to private visibility, but the runs were done in a shared workspace.

Effectively this app is private to me (the author), unless I change the version visibility. This behavior will change once https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-1974 is implemented (on our wishlist for Q1) - if you have access to the project's workspace, you'll also have access to the app.

In the short-term, would you have preferred to still see the modal, or for the link to be disabled entirely?

I understand the ask here, but this would be a big lift technically - the reason we do it this way is so that we don’t have to load the permissions of the app until you actually try to open the app. Otherwise we need to load whether you have access to each app we’re displaying in this list. But yeah, this should be fixed by the app sharing initiative!
